item.title: Why Students Should Turn Off ChatGPT: Rejecting AI as a Learning Crutch
item.description:
Originally captured in a voice memo during a walk across campus, this reflection examines the risks of relying on generative AI tools in education and advocates for a return to foundational learning practices.

The Allure and the Risk

My name is Krish, and as a computer science student whose college years have coincided with the rapid rise of generative AI, I have witnessed firsthand how tools like ChatGPT, Gemini, and Cursor infiltrate academic workflows. While these technologies promise efficiency, I believe their unchecked use in educational settings, particularly for independent student work, represents a net negative for a substantial portion of computer science learners. This view may seem at odds with my upcoming role at a frontier AI lab, yet it stems from a clear distinction: AI excels as an accelerator for those who already grasp core concepts, not as a substitute for building them.

item.title: How Zero Cost Schooling Builds Purpose
item.description:
While originaly written as a letter to the Friends of Park Scholarships, this reflection explores how programs that eliminate our relative educational costs fundamentally transform our ability to take risks and pursue meaningful work.

The Hidden Value: Risk Capital

My name is Krish, and I am a Park Scholar in the Class of 2026. While the opportunities this prestigious program has provided have been life-changing in many ways, I want to share a perspective that often goes undiscussed: how programs that drive the cost of attendance down to zero or close to it fundamentally transform our ability to take risks and pursue meaningful work.
